Charater-Traits.meaning: Inclined to conceal feelings and intentions or not to disclose information.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Reliant on one's own powers and resources rather than those of others.
Charater-Traits.sentence: After living alone for years, she became very self-reliant.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Lacking consideration for others; concerned chiefly with one's own personal profit or pleasure.
Charater-Traits.sentence: It was selfish of him to eat the whole cake.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Quick to detect or respond to slight changes, signals, or influences; easily hurt or offended.
Charater-Traits.sentence: She is very sensitive to criticism.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Nervous or timid in the company of other people.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Having or showing a lack of common sense or judgment; absurd and foolish.
Charater-Traits.sentence: We were laughing and making silly faces for the camera.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Free from pretense or deceit; proceeding from genuine feelings.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Furtive; sly.

Charater-Traits.sentence: He was snobbish and refused to talk to anyone he didn't know.

Charater-Traits.sentence: She is a sociable person who loves going to parties.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Performed or occurring as a result of a sudden inner impulse or inclination; not planned.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Unwilling to give or spend; ungenerous.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Unusual or surprising; difficult to understand or explain.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Having the power to move heavy weights or perform other physically demanding tasks.
Charater-Traits.sentence: He is strong enough to lift the heavy box.

Charater-Traits.sentence: He was a studious child who always had his nose in a book.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Existing or occurring at or on the surface; not deep or thorough.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Having the pleasant taste characteristic of sugar or honey; pleasing in general.
Charater-Traits.sentence: That was a very sweet thing for you to do.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Having or showing skill and sensitivity in dealing with others or with difficult issues.
Charater-Traits.sentence: She gave a tactful answer to his inappropriate question.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Having a natural aptitude or skill for something.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Fond of or given to talking.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Showing good aesthetic judgment or appropriate behavior.
Charater-Traits.sentence: The room was decorated in a tasteful and elegant style.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Tending to keep a firm hold of something; persisting in existence or a course of action.
Charater-Traits.sentence: The tenacious reporter would not give up until she got the story.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Showing consideration for the needs of other people.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Using money and other resources carefully and not wastefully.
Charater-Traits.sentence: By being thrifty, she was able to save enough money for a vacation.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Showing a lack of courage or confidence; easily frightened.
Charater-Traits.sentence: The timid kitten hid under the bed.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Willing or able to accept behavior or opinions different from one's own.
Charater-Traits.sentence: She has a tolerant attitude towards different cultures.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Oversensitive and irritable.
Charater-Traits.sentence: He is very touchy about his recent breakup, so don't mention it.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Strong enough to withstand adverse conditions or rough handling.
Charater-Traits.sentence: He had a tough time, but he never gave up.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Inclined to believe in the reliability, truth, ability, or strength of someone or something.
Charater-Traits.sentence: He has a very trusting nature and believes everything people tell him.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Able to be relied on as honest or truthful.
Charater-Traits.sentence: She is a trustworthy friend who will never betray a secret.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Not displaying warmth or sympathy.
Charater-Traits.sentence: The new boss seemed uncaring about the employees' concerns.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Not being under control; out of control.
Charater-Traits.sentence: The fire raged uncontrolled through the forest.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Not willing to work with others.
Charater-Traits.sentence: The uncooperative suspect refused to answer any questions.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Sympathetically aware of other people's feelings; tolerant and forgiving.
Charater-Traits.sentence: My parents were very understanding when I told them I failed the test.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Not kind or pleasant.
Charater-Traits.sentence: The waiter was unfriendly and seemed annoyed by our questions.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Not able to be foreseen or predicted.
Charater-Traits.sentence: The weather in the mountains is very unpredictable.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Not able to be relied upon.
Charater-Traits.sentence: His car is old and unreliable; it breaks down constantly.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Willing to put the needs or wishes of others before one's own.
Charater-Traits.sentence: Her unselfish decision to donate her kidney saved her brother's life.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Able to be used for a practical purpose or in several ways.
Charater-Traits.sentence: This pocket knife is a very useful tool.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Possessing or showing courage or determination.
Charater-Traits.sentence: The valiant knight charged at the dragon to save the princess.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Able to adapt or be adapted to many different functions or activities.
Charater-Traits.sentence: A smartphone is a versatile device that can be used for many things.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Using or involving physical force intended to hurt, damage, or kill.
Charater-Traits.sentence: A violent storm knocked down trees and power lines.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Lacking sophistication or good taste; unrefined.
Charater-Traits.sentence: He told a vulgar joke that made everyone uncomfortable.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Sympathetic and kind.
Charater-Traits.sentence: She is a warm-hearted person who always helps those in need.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Lacking physical strength and energy.
Charater-Traits.sentence: He felt weak after being sick for a week.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Suggesting something supernatural; uncanny or very strange.
Charater-Traits.sentence: I had a weird dream last night.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Having or showing experience, knowledge, and good judgment.
Charater-Traits.sentence: My grandmother gave me some wise advice.

Charater-Traits.meaning: Showing or characterized by quick and inventive verbal humor.
Charater-Traits.sentence: She is known for her witty comments and clever comebacks.
